title: the Protection of the Collective Interests of Consumers Act 2023 (Section 29)
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Representative Actions for
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Representative Actions for 
the Protection of the Collective Interests of Consumers Act 2023 (Section 29) 
(Maximum Fee) Regulations 2024. 

(2) These Regulations shall come into operation on the 30th day of April
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited representative action protection collective interest consumer act 2023 (section 29) (maximum fee) regulation 2024 (2) regulation shall come operation 30th day april

title: the Protection of the Collective Interests of Consumers Act 2023 (Section 29)
the Protection of the Collective Interests of Consumers Act 2023 (Section 29)
heading: 2. A fee of €25 is prescribed for the purposes of section 29(5) of the
text_raw:
2. A fee of €25 is prescribed for the purposes of section 29(5) of the 
Representative Actions for the Protection of the Collective Interests of 
Consumers Act 2023 (No. 22 of 2023). 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

30 April, 2024. 

PETER BURKE, 

Minister for Enterprise, Trade and Employment. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 3rd May, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [183] 3

title: the Protection of the Collective Interests of Consumers Act 2023 (Section 29)
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide for a qualified entity to charge a modest fee to a 
consumer, requesting to be represented in a representative action for redress, 
under section 29 of the Act. 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [183]
